comment: She was alright but if you can take someone else do it. Attendance is mandatory, it's technically your grade since you can't make up any missing assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: She's a stickler for rules like no exposed ankles/chest, no sitting during lab, and must have the entire lab report written out in your book before class. She explains the concept of the lab before doing it and is open for questions or to ask for clarification. I took a 50% hybrid class and I honestly did better on the in-person labs.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: If you do not follow the dress code to a T and stand for the entire lab you will never hear the end of it. She can be very rude if you don't hand write the lab procedures correctly. If you miss a lab there are no make ups. The lab procedures are extensive but you have to write every single step and they do not explain the pre-lab quizzes well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: This is a lab so no attendance equals no grade. No makeups unless Covid related. Sometimes the chemistry class won't match up with the lab and you might have just been introduced to the subject the lab is on.
answers questions and emails and very laidback. a lot of the work in labs are for you do to so just make sure you are on top of everything!

She's not awful, but she's not great. She'll help you in the lab if you have questions but she was a very tough grader to me. Ex. she deducted 50 pts from my assignment because a tiny bit of her signature was cut off in the pic I had to submit. I worked really hard in this class and usually get A's but since chem isn't my strong suit I got a B.

Come to lab in dress code (no ankles showing). Don't be late. Have an organized lab notebook. Do well on the lab procedures. Tidrick would help if you asked for help. She also explained lab before doing it. If you try you will have an A, but if you don't try and slack then you will probably have a B.
If you take the lab hybrid then you use lab flow and it is a lot of after lab work. She does a bad job of explaining the labs She is really laid back and chill but she doesnt teach.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: take her !! she answers all lab questions during lab and will even help you understand small processes while lab is happening. shes great at giving feedback and helping you understand what you did in lab. Consists of prelab quizzes , lab, a lab report, and a lab notebook submission + content assessments + final at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Take her if you want an easy A/B, she is really good and makes it easy to go though her class. You go to class every other week and when you are not in class, you have to do a practice and a regular assessment, not that hard. No more hw. Pre lab quizzes are easy and do not skip class, no make-ups. Just take her, she is fine!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: its a little over half way through the semester but shes a great lab instructor! very clear deadlines and expectations, answers questions in labs and approaches you to ensure theres no doubts. Includes in person labs, lab reports that are essentially data submissions & occasional general assessments online

Ms. Tidrick is a wonderful teacher! Literally all you have to do is show up to labs and do your work on time. If you do not understand something email her and send a picture and in less than 24 hours she will give you feedback. She truly cares for your success. She even created videos on the content that even helps in regular chem class!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.
